result.execSummary:
The defendant David L Scarbrough II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber for work or treatment. Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HOC screening. Credit for FIFTY-SEVEN (57) DAYS time served.

miscConds.notes:
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment WITH tax intercept.
* Obtain and maintain employment or school or vocational training.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

* Maintain absolute sobriety.  
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain stable residence.

timeConds.notes: * Court ordered the defendant to serve NINETY (90) DAYS in the House of Correction.  SIXTY (60) DAYS FORTHWITH.  THIRTY(30) DAYS STAYED,  to be used at agent's discretion.  STRAIGHT TIME.  GOOD TIME CREDIT TO APPLY.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David L Scarbrough in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by:  SHEENA S.

Court went off the Record to hold Sidebar with Counsel and Defendant's family.  Hearing continued on the Record.

Defendant sentenced to serve ONE (1) YEAR in the House of Correction with credit for FIFTY-SEVEN (57) DAYS time served.  Huber privileges for work or treatment.  Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HoC screening.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of EIGHTEEN (18) MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

* Court ordered the defendant to serve NINETY (90) DAYS in the House of Correction.  SIXTY (60) DAYS FORTHWITH.  THIRTY(30) DAYS STAYED,  to be used at agent's discretion.  STRAIGHT TIME.  GOOD TIME CREDIT TO APPLY.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain stable residence.
* Obtain and maintain employment or school or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment WITH tax intercept.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant David L Scarbrough in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant David L Scarbrough in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

VETERANS COURT

Prior to matter being called on the Record,  matter was extensively staffed.  Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  STATE RENEWED THEIR MOTION TO REVOKE.  Defense OPPOSED Revocation but DID acknowledge violations that form the basis for the State's Motion.  Defense advised that there are further constraints that could be implemented if the Defendant is allowed to continue.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  On Motion of the State,  Court REVOKED the VTI/DPA;  proceedings reinstated.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  DEFENDANT IS REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT DATE.

Defendant David L Scarbrough in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant David L Scarbrough in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

VETERANS COURT

Review hearing proceeded.  STATE RENEWED THEIR MOTION TO REVOKE THE VTI/DPA.  COURT TOOK THE MOTION TO REVOKE UNDER ADVISEMENT AT THIS TIME.  Defendant to be placed on SCRAM.  Defendant to have a non-relative payee.  Defendant to compose letter per instruction of the Court.  Court finds that the defendant is not in compliance with the Veterans Treatment Initiative Court Contract.  DEFENDANT IS REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT DATE.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

VETERANS COURT

Defendant is non-compliant with the Agreement.  On Motion of the State,  Court ordered Bench Warrant issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.
ALL OTHER CONDITIONS OF BAIL ARE TO REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Defendant David L Scarbrough in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

VETERAN COURT

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  Based upon Defendant's relapse and non-compliance,  State moved to REVOKE the Agreement.  Defense OBJECTED the Revocation as the Defendant has NOT run out of time.  Arguments heard.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court went off the Record to allow Defendant time to confer with his Attorney.  Hearing continued on the Record.  COURT CONTINUED the VTI/DPA.  Court GRANTED Defendant's request to attend the family Funeral.  DEFENDANT IS NOT TO OPERATE ANY MOTOR VEHICLES.  Court cautioned Defendant that if he drives again he WILL be REVOKED.  Defendant to return to Wisconsin IMMEDIATELY following the funeral.  Court ordered matter adjourned for Review in Br. 33.  Review hearing scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant David L Scarbrough in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant David L Scarbrough not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
I called the number he provided and I spoke with a female assuming it's his mother. I informed her that the court date they gave him (4-24-2015) is incorrect. Our court is down on that day I asked her to let Mr. Scarbrough know that the court date will be Thursday 4-23-2015, at 1:30 pm. She told me that she will give him the message and if he has a problem with that court date he will call me and I provided her with my number.
  Initial appearance scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/24/15 @ 1:30pm
